law_name: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA)
response_deadline: 15 calendar days (3 business days for written response if not immediately available)
notes: No citizenship requirement. No fee waivers. No administrative appeals. Attorney General has complaint process. Search fees prohibited. Recent 2024 court decisions expanded scope.

basic_request.subject: IPRA Request for Public Records
basic_request.body:
Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), NMSA 1978, Sections 14-2-1 to 14-2-12, I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following public records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

Under NMSA 14-2-8, please permit inspection of these records immediately or as soon as practicable, but no later than 15 calendar days after receiving this request.

If inspection cannot be permitted within 3 business days, please provide a written response explaining when the records will be available for inspection.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide written denial within 15 calendar days citing the specific IPRA exemption under NMSA 14-2-1.

I understand that reasonable fees may be charged for copies at actual cost, but that search fees are not permitted under New Mexico law. No statement of purpose is required under IPRA.

I prefer to receive responsive records in electronic format when possible to minimize costs. Please contact me if you need clarification regarding this request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: IPRA Violation Complaint
appeal_template.body:
TO THE NEW MEXICO ATTORNEY GENERAL:

I am filing this complaint regarding a violation of the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act by [AGENCY NAME].

REQUEST DETAILS:
Date of Request: [DATE]
Agency: [AGENCY NAME]
Custodian: [CUSTODIAN NAME]
Records Requested: [DESCRIPTION]

VIOLATION:
The agency [DESCRIBE VIOLATION - failed to respond within 15 calendar days / improperly denied request / etc.]. This violates NMSA 14-2-8.

[If denial] The agency cited [EXEMPTION CLAIMED], but this exemption under NMSA 14-2-1 does not apply because [LEGAL REASONING]. The requested records are public records subject to disclosure under IPRA.

RELIEF REQUESTED:
I respectfully request the Attorney General:
1. Investigate this IPRA violation;
2. Attempt informal resolution with the agency;
3. File suit if necessary to enforce IPRA compliance;
4. Order the agency to provide access to the requested records.

Alternatively, I may file a mandamus action in district court to compel disclosure.

Please contact me if you need additional information regarding this complaint.

Respectfully submitted,
[YOUR NAME]
[ADDRESS]
[PHONE]
[EMAIL]

Submit to:
New Mexico Attorney General
Government Counsel & Accountability Team
PO Drawer 1508
Santa Fe, NM 87504-1508
